titleStmt.title: Isaac Whitehead to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4506

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Mount Vernon Rockcastle Co Ky Dec 30th 1863

To His Excellency The Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner Isaac Whitehead states that at the August term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court He was fine $20. under the Gaming Laws and that he presented a petition to the Governor signed by the circuit Judge and Commonwealth attorney and was informed that his fine had been remitted and knew no better until within a few weeks back. the then Circuit Court Clerk Died and if the order came remitting the fine it has been lost He also represents that he is a poor man, and a good Union man, and asks to have his fine remitted
We the undersigned think Mr Whitehead should have his fine remitted.=

E. T. Fish C. R. Cir. C
W. A. Brooks
James G. Carter
W M Fish C. R. C. C
Edwin Shivel C. S. C. R. C.
Wm McClure G. K. C
G.O.R. McCall
James W. Smith

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
J. Whitehead
$20 --
Gaming

Remit except fees & costs it was heretofore done.
T E Bramlette
12th Janry
1864
